data.title: Philip José Farmer (Kilgore Trout): Venus on the Half
data.text:
Genre Science Fiction Type Novel Series

Wold Newton Universe

Written as by Kilgore Trout (pseudonym / fictional author).

See this webpage with Farmer's story about Kilgore Trout.

Slightly expanded from the magazine version "Venus on the Half-Shell".

Farmer introduces another fictional author, Jonathan Swift Somers III, and his works about Ralph von Wau Wau.

DEDICATION: "Dedicated to the beasts and the stars. They don't worry about free will and immortality." COVER TEXT:

WARNING: At the end of this book you will find the Definitive Answer to the Ultimate Question.

Simon Wagstaff is the Space Wanderer, a seeker of truth and electric banjo player who narrowly escapes the Deluge that destroys Earth when he happens upon an abandoned Chinese spaceship, the Hwang Ho. A man without a planet, he gains immortality from an elixer drunk during a sexual interlude with a cat-like alien queen in heat. Now, with his pet owl, his dog Anubis and a sexy robot companion, Simon charts a 3,000-year course to the most distant corners of a multiverse full of surprises to seek out the answers to the questions no one can seem to answer.

(Bantam Spectra)

Omnibus with two novels. Also with all the translated essays and stories from the Titan publication above:

- Foreword "Почему и как я стал Килгором Траутом" by Philip José Farmer

- Preface "Неприметная жизнь и тяжелые времена Килгора Траута: Спорные моменты биографии" by Philip José Farmer

- Afterword "Джонатан Свифт Сомерс-Третий: Космический скиталец в инвалидной коляске" by Philip José Farmer

- Afterword "Режиссер маскарада Траута. Теперь об этом можно рассказать по другому — правда о Трауте" by Jonathan Swift Somers III (= Michael Croteau & Rhys Hughes)

- Afterword "Реальнее чем сама жизнь: Филип Хосе Фармер, период масок" by Christopher Paul Carey

Gadino
